intro: Barbacenia purpurea var. minor, commonly known as the purple barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple bracts that surround its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
